text: The Kakching Garden () is a garden on the Uyok Ching hill to the west of the Kakching airfield. It is in the Kakching district of Manipur. It has many shrines of different religions, including those of traditional Meitei religion (Sanamahism) and Hinduism. == Religious sites == === Traditional Meitei religion === There is a temple dedicated to Pakhangba inside the garden. The sculpture of the goddess Haoreima Shampubi is an important artwork in the garden. === Hinduism === The temple housing a statue of Hindu God Shiva inside the garden is sacred to Hindus . == Related pages == * Tourist attractions in Manipur == References == Category:Gardens
title: Kakching Garden
